intro: Leucas quinquedentata, commonly known as the five-toothed leucas, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with ornamental and medicinal value. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and opposite, ovate leaves with five distinct teeth along the edges. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and potential pharmacological properties, it is of interest to botanists and herbalists alike.
